datasets.name: Starter
datasets.description: A small dataset of 3 parameters each ranging values between 1 and 10.

datasets.name: Sinusoidal
datasets.description: The sinusoidal data demonstrates AiSara capability to learn pattern with minimal data. This is how AiSara is different than an artificial neural network. Plot xx vs xx to see the pattern and try to fill up the blanks spaces using PREDICT.

datasets.name: history_match_6v
datasets.description:
The history match data is from oil and gas reservoir simulation example. The current results are not yet optimised and we can use Aisara to investigate the possible outcome of runs that we haven't done yet, the benefit here is saving time and understanding the results.

Example: 

In cell A2 enter LEARN (xxx).
In cell xx Using the formula PREDICT (xx xx xx xx xx as input) i can get xx. In our case that is actually quite close to actual simulation results.

datasets.name: logs
datasets.description: Large data set of 4 subsurface logs : Depth, Water Saturation, Porosity and Gamma Ray. With a prediction of permeability as the output. log, create pseudo log from this existing data or Use Predict feature to fill in the gap

datasets.name: logs_mini
datasets.description: Large data set of 4 subsurface logs : Depth, Water Saturation, Porosity and Gamma Ray. With a prediction of permeability as the output. log, create pseudo log from this existing data or Use Predict feature to fill in the gap

datasets.name: production
datasets.target: 1st month prod,3rd month prod,6th month prod,1st year prod,2nd year prod,3rd year prod,5th year prod
datasets.description:
A synthetic production data set that AiSara can help create production forecast with sensitivity analysis.
Input: (3) permeability, oil viscosity, oil pay thickness from 10 wells.
Output: Forecast (Time)

datasets.name: rf
datasets.description: Often time, we want to be able to gauge recovery factor of a reservoir based on analog. This dataset is an example of how this can be done. The source of the sample data is from SPE paper xxxx. Using the LEARN function as you would use any other Excel function, AiSara can learn the relationship between the input and output You can also use the LEARN menu above if you like. Then you can predict the RF using the PREDICT function. Do you have enough data to make a reliable prediction? Check out our BLINDTEST feature to find out.
